db:abstract.db:para: Wraps the most important methods of Android ServiceConnection class.

db:para.db:emphasis: This class is under development and is subject to change.

db:abstract.db:para: This class was introduced in Qt 6.2.

db:para.db:emphasis: This class is under development and is subject to change.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The QAndroidServiceConnection is a convenience abstract class which wraps the AndroidServiceConnection interface.
It is useful when you perform a QtAndroidPrivate::bindService operation.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QAndroidServiceConnection::QAndroidServiceConnection(const int &serviceConnection)
db:section.db:para: Creates a new object from an existing serviceConnection.
It's useful when you have your own Java implementation. Of course onServiceConnected()/onServiceDisconnected() will not be called anymore.

db:section.db:title: [pure virtual] void QAndroidServiceConnection::onServiceConnected(const QString &name, const QAndroidBinder &serviceBinder)
db:section.db:para: This notification is called when the client managed to connect to the service. The name contains the server name, the serviceBinder is the binder that the client uses to perform IPC operations.

db:warning.db:para: This method is called from Binder's thread which is different from the thread that this object was created.

db:section.db:title: [pure virtual] void QAndroidServiceConnection::onServiceDisconnected(const QString &name)
db:section.db:para: Called when a connection to the Service has been lost. The name parameter specifies which connectioen was lost.

db:warning.db:para: This method is called from Binder's thread which is different from the thread that this object was created.
